snippet: The 2013 conviction of a former New York City police officer in a plot to kidnap, torture, kill and eat women was overturned late Monday by a federal judge who said there was not sufficient evidence to support it.
abstract: Conviction of former New York City Police Officer Gilberto Valle in plot to kidnap, torture, kill and eat women is overturned by Judge Paul G Gardephe of Federal District Court in Manhattan for insufficient evidence; judge grants former officer a verdict of acquittal on charge of kidnapping conspiracy, which could have brought life sentence; Valle now faces maximum sentence of one year on additional charge, and he has been dismissed from force.
lead_paragraph: The 2013 conviction of a former New York City police officer in a plot to kidnap, torture, kill and eat women was overturned late Monday by a federal judge who said there was not sufficient evidence to support it.

headline.main: Officer’s Conviction in Cannibalism Case Overturned
headline.print_headline: Officer’s Conviction in Cannibalism Case Overturned
